instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD: What is SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD? SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a pre-requisite for SYS_PWROK_R and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi,

I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board liquid damaged in <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> area.  I have cpuvcore 1.7v but no chime no fan spin . 
I found <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> missing and <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> present but no <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.

There is no short to ground in <SIGNAL>DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL> line.

appriciate your help.

Thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Inspected <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for liquid damage? Any corrosion near SMC/BIOS area?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Hi John, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> has been replaced due to liquid dmg and smc replaced. check witha different bios still the same. I get the clock signal properly.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Does PP3v42 make it to pin 8 on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: yes it is. problem is <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL> doesnt come to pin 6 on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>. and thats why no <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> not present

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R5191</RESISTOR> checked? Voltage present on resistor by chance? Also resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Seems like SMC issue to me. Was SMC replaced from identical donor board? Try another one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi Duke, spot on right and solved. I replaced the SMC from identical donor board but that smc faulty as well. I replaced another SMC and it works fine. Thank you for your help.
Also Thank you John for your help.
